parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post information.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any parliamentary candidate. It promotes an event discussing social media and violence, featuring a criminology professor and a journalist as speakers.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and is designed to reach a wide audience interested in the topic of social media and violence. The multilingual nature of the post (Hungarian, Romanian, English) further suggests a broad target audience.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The objective of the post is to promote an academic event, not to influence the outcome of any election. The content of the event is related to social media and violence, a topic unrelated to the parliamentary elections.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The event promotes a discussion on a relevant social issue, featuring experts in the field.  The description resembles journalistic promotion of an event with academic and public interest.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>Not applicable. The post doesn't express personal opinions; it promotes a public event.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>8670389153010975</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post promotes an academic event focused on social media and violence.  There is no mention of any parliamentary candidate or party, nor any attempt to influence voters. The event's topic is unrelated to the electoral process. While the post is categorized as "POLITICAL" due to the nature of the discussion topic, it does not constitute electoral propaganda as defined by Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015. The event is educational and informative, falling under the category of allowed ads.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>Mathias Corvinus Collegium</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
